Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.rmi

Class GameControllerWrapper

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.network.rmi.GameControllerWrapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
VirtualController, Serializable, Remote
public class GameControllerWrapper extends UnicastRemoteObject implements VirtualController
Remote Object that allows RMI clients to send message directly calling method on this object. Remote calls will be "converted" into messages. Those messages will be forwarded to the GameController and then processed asynchronously.
See Also:

    • GameControllerWrapper

      public GameControllerWrapper(GameController gameController) throws RemoteException
      Builds a new GameControllerWrapper remote objet that wraps the provided GameController
      Parameters:
      gameController - GameController that needs to be wrapped
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of errors with the remote communication.

    • placeCard

      public void placeCard(String playerIdentifier, int index, boolean onBackSide, CardLocation location) throws RemoteException
      Allows to place a card on the player's board.
      Specified by:
      placeCard in interface VirtualController
      Parameters:
      playerIdentifier - The string that the player received while joining/creating the game.
      index - The index of the player's hand that contains the cards that needs to be placed.
      onBackSide - true if the cards should be placed with the back side up, false otherwise.
      location - The CardLocation that represents the desired placement location of the card.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - in case of errors with the remote communication.

      index - The number that represents what the player's trying to draw/pick up.

    • sendChatMsg

      public void sendChatMsg(String playerIdentifier, String message, String addressee) throws RemoteException
      Allows to send a chat message
      Specified by:
      sendChatMsg in interface VirtualController
      Parameters:
      playerIdentifier - the string that the player received while joining/creating the game
      message - the message that the player want to send
      addressee - the nickname of the player that needs to receive this message, null for public messages
